intro: Trichera ovatifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaf trichera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its ovate, velvety leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some tropical gardens.
